Package com.example.qr_quest

Class QRDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.qr_quest.QRDatabase
  • public class QRDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to handle the Firebase Cloud Firestore database operations related to QR codes. It allows to add and update QR codes, as well as to check if a specific QR code already exists in the database and update the users that scanned it.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  QRDatabase.AdditionCallback
      The interface for the callback that is triggered when a QR code is successfully added to the database.

      Constructs a new instance of the QRDatabase class with the specified context and QR object.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> addQR()
      Creates a map of QR code details.

      Adds a user to a QR code's scanned by list in the database.
      static void getHighestQR​(java.lang.String username, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot> listener)
      Retrieves the QR document with the highest score that the specified user has scanned after querying through all QR codes in the collections.
      static void getLowestQR​(java.lang.String username, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot> listener)
      Retrieves the QR document with the lowest score that the specified user has scanned after querying through all QR codes in the collections.
      void setAdditionCallback​(QRDatabase.AdditionCallback additionCallback)
      Sets the callback that is triggered when a QR code is successfully added to the database.

        Constructs a new instance of the QRDatabase class with the specified context and QR object.

        context - The context of the application
        new_QR - The QR object that is being added or updated in the database

    • Method Detail

      • setAdditionCallback

        public void setAdditionCallback​(QRDatabase.AdditionCallback additionCallback)
        Sets the callback that is triggered when a QR code is successfully added to the database.
        Parameters:
        additionCallback - The callback to be set

      • addQRCodeCheck

        public void addQRCodeCheck​(java.lang.String username)
        Checks if the specified QR code already exists in the database and adds it if it doesn't. Also updates the users that scanned the QR code.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user that scanned the QR code

      • addQR

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> addQR()
        Creates a map of QR code details.
        Returns:
        A map of QR code details.

      • updateQRCode

        public void updateQRCode​(com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.lang.Boolean> listener)
        Updates a QR code in the database.
        Parameters:
        listener - The success listener for the update.

      • addUserToQrCode

        public void addUserToQrCode​(android.content.Context context,
                            QR qrCode,
                            java.lang.String username,
                            com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.lang.Boolean> listener)
        Adds a user to a QR code's scanned by list in the database.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the application.
        qrCode - The QR code to which the user should be added.
        username - The username of the user to be added.
        listener - The success listener for the addition.

      • getHighestQR

        public static void getHighestQR​(java.lang.String username,
                                com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot> listener)
        Retrieves the QR document with the highest score that the specified user has scanned after querying through all QR codes in the collections.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user to check
        listener - A listener to be called with the resulting document snapshot

      • getLowestQR

        public static void getLowestQR​(java.lang.String username,
                               com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot> listener)
        Retrieves the QR document with the lowest score that the specified user has scanned after querying through all QR codes in the collections.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user to check
        listener - A listener to be called with the resulting document snapshot
